metadata.synopsis: Player approaches Tara and sees she is carrying an item. Player tries to convince Tara to give the item over. If Gale is in party he will be favoured speaker and will recognize Tara and why she has a magic item with her.

30.speaker: Gale
30.text: Tara, I don't suppose you're responsible for the missing messenger pigeons...

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: I'd offer you some of your favourite meat, but I haven't got any. Beholder jerky is surprisingly hard to come by.

55.speaker: Gale
55.text: Very well. Enjoy your feast, Tara.

14.speaker: Tara the Tressym
14.text: Mr Dekarios! Heavens, fancy seeing you here!
14.context: NodeContext: Pretending she doesn't speak Common.

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: Tara! That can't be you, can it?

43.speaker: Tara the Tressym
43.text: I suppose you won't be terribly shocked to find your old friend Tara amongst the pigeons. They've always been a personal favourite.

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: My, is that a ring? For us? You shouldn't have.

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: Enjoy yourself now, Tara. Looks like you've got yourself set up quite nicely here.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: What's your tressym doing here, Gale?

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: She isn't my tressym. She's my friend. And from the looks of things, it appears she's eating pigeons.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Can you ask her to stop eating pigeons?

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Hang on - isn't this where the post house's courier pigeons roost? Should she be eating them?

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Gale, she's been eating those missing courier pigeons. Tell her to stop!

78.speaker: Gale
78.text: Oh. Right. Did you hear that, Tara? Erm. Stop it.

0.speaker: Tara the Tressym
0.text: Well! These must be important birds indeed, Mr Dekarios. Forgive me for feasting on their bodies and bones so very voraciously.

29.speaker: Tara the Tressym
29.text: Mr Dekarios! Heavens, fancy seeing you here!
29.context: NodeContext: Pretending she doesn't speak Common.

11.speaker: Tara the Tressym
11.text: I suppose you won't be terribly shocked to find your old friend Tara amongst the pigeons. They've always been a personal favourite.

1.speaker: Tara the Tressym
1.text: Oh, but that reminds me! I've found you something. A lovely little keepsake. In the past it might've helped with your condition, but now that you're better, perhaps you can put it to some other use.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the ring and the letters at Tara's feet.

44.speaker: Tara the Tressym
44.text: I know, I know, but I just love you so.

75.speaker: Gale
75.text: Tara, I don't suppose you're responsible for the missing messenger pigeons...

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: Hang on - isn't this where the post house's courier pigeons roost? I don't suppose you've been eating them...

52.speaker: Tara the Tressym
52.text: One needn't guess. Pigeon meat is my second-favourite.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: No more pigeons, Tara. They have an important job to do.

31.speaker: Tara the Tressym
31.text: Importance is relative. A letter may be important to one; a growling belly may be more important to another.

48.speaker: Tara the Tressym
48.text: You aren't going to scold me, are you, sir?

39.speaker: Gale
39.text: No, but I am going to make you very sorry if you don't stop.

41.speaker: Tara the Tressym
41.text: Well! These must be important birds indeed, Mr Dekarios. Forgive me for feasting on their bodies and bones so very voraciously.

17.speaker: Tara the Tressym
17.text: I'll be on my way, then. There are a few places in the city I'd like to visit. I might've sussed some interesting items I'd rather like to get my paws upon. If I find anything interesting, I might even be willing to share.

15.speaker: Tara the Tressym
15.text: Until then, all on the up and up with you, sir?

2.speaker: Gale
2.text: More or less. But the city is still in danger.

35.speaker: Tara the Tressym
35.text: Hop to it, then, sir. Imminent peril is terrible for my digestion.

46.speaker: Gale
46.text: Up to my eyeballs in drama, deceit, and subterfuge. Nothing unusual.

9.speaker: Tara the Tressym
9.text: You love it, don't you, sir? Like a fish in water.

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: We'll catch up later, Tara - there's no time now.

6.speaker: Tara the Tressym
6.text: You're lucky I adore you, you mutton-head.

50.speaker: Tara the Tressym
50.text: I'll see you soon, I'm sure, Mr Dekarios. Do take care of yourself, all right?

62.speaker: Tara the Tressym
62.text: Actually, Mr Dekarios, I think the sorry one will be you.
62.context: InternalNodeContext: TAra launches a magic missle/ fireball at Gale

64.speaker: Gale
64.text: I am. Stop that, Tara! You need to leave the pigeons be.

49.speaker: Tara the Tressym
49.text: In actual fact, I'm going to eat them up even faster and more voraciously than I did before. How about that?
49.context: InternalNodeContext: TAra eats all the pigeons after this

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: There's a much better aviary across town, if you've already picked over the choice cuts here.

40.speaker: Tara the Tressym
40.text: Another aviary, you say? Well, that does sound quite interesting. The brood here is getting a little thin.

28.speaker: Tara the Tressym
28.text: Perhaps while I'm seeking out this new feasthall, I'll pay a few visits around town. I might've sussed some interesting items I'd rather like to get my paws upon.

36.speaker: Tara the Tressym
36.text: If I find anything interesting, I might even be willing to share.

4.speaker: Tara the Tressym
4.text: I haven't. In fact, I've got a great deal more to eat, indeed. And neither you nor anyone else is going to stop me, Mr Dekarios. Tara away!

56.speaker: Tara the Tressym
56.text: Thank you. I most certainly will, sir.

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: Time to move along, Tara. If you get caught here, you'll be in trouble.

51.speaker: Tara the Tressym
51.text: Anyone who tries to remove me will be in far worse trouble, I assure you.

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: I'd offer you some of your favourite meat, but I haven't got any. Beholder jerky is surprisingly hard to come by.

72.speaker: Tara the Tressym
72.text: More's the pity. But no bother. These pigeons are quite delicious.
